intro: Leysera montana, commonly known as the mountain leysera, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically blue or violet, arranged in whorls along the stem, and bloom during the cooler months. Leysera montana is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions.
